newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: S.LANKA'S NDB TO LAUNCH 250 RUPEES/SHR IPO.
newsitem.headline: S.LANKA'S NDB TO LAUNCH 250 RUPEES/SHR IPO.

text.p: Sri Lankan blue chip National Development Bank Ltd (NDB) said on Wednesday it will launch an initial public offering (IPO) of 900,000 shares at 250 rupees per share on August 28.
"Though the issue opens on the Colombo Stock Exchange on August 28, the public can begin applying for shares from August 19," Ranjit Fernando, general manager of NDB told Reuters.
The government converted 27.5 million NDB debentures to 18.33 million shares under an early conversion agreement, and offered 16.5 million shares to foreign investors at 260 rupees each last week.
"We wanted to give some concession to local shareholders," Fernando said explaining the IPO price. "And the foreign investors agreed."
Fernando said the overseas offer, which was oversubscribed, attracted a significant number of first-time investors to Colombo.
"Since we expect the IPO to be as successful, there is no underwriting agreement," Fernando said.
The scrip last traded at 280 rupees a 10-rupee share on August 12.
